00022 #include "NicEntryDebug.h"
00023 
00024 #include <cassert>
00025 
00026 #include "ChannelAccess.h"
00027 #include "FindModule.h"
00028 
00029 #ifndef nicEV
00030 #define nicEV (ev.isDisabled()||!coreDebug) ? ev : ev << "NicEntry: "
00031 #endif
00032 
00033 using std::endl;
00034 
00035 void NicEntryDebug::connectTo(NicEntry* other) {
00036   nicEV<<"connecting nic #"<<nicId<< " and #"<<other->nicId<<endl;
00037 
00038   NicEntryDebug* otherNic = (NicEntryDebug*) other;
00039 
00040   cGate *localoutgate = requestOutGate();
00041   localoutgate->connectTo(otherNic->requestInGate());
00042   outConns[other] = localoutgate->getPathStartGate();
00043 }
00044 
00045 
00046 void NicEntryDebug::disconnectFrom(NicEntry* other) {
00047   nicEV<<"disconnecting nic #"<<nicId<< " and #"<<other->nicId<<endl;
00048 
00049   NicEntryDebug* otherNic = (NicEntryDebug*) other;
00050 
00051   //search the connection in the outConns list
00052   GateList::iterator p = outConns.find(other);
00053   //no need to check whether entry is valid; is already check by ConnectionManager isConnected
00054   //get the hostGate
00055   //order is phyGate->nicGate->hostGate
00056   cGate* hostGate = p->second->getNextGate()->getNextGate();
00057 
00058   // release local out gate
00059   freeOutGates.push_back(hostGate);
00060 
00061   // release remote in gate
00062   otherNic->freeInGates.push_back(hostGate->getNextGate());
00063 
00064   //reset gates
00065   //hostGate->getNextGate()->connectTo(0);
00066   hostGate->disconnect();
00067 
00068   //delete the connection
00069   outConns.erase(p);
00070 }
00071 
00072 int NicEntryDebug::collectGates(const char* pattern, GateStack& gates)
00073 {
00074   cModule* host = FindModule<>::findHost(nicPtr);
00075   int i = 1;
00076   char gateName[20];
00077   //create the unique name for the gate (composed of the nic module id and a counter)
00078   sprintf(gateName, pattern, nicId, i);
00079   while(host->hasGate(gateName))
00080   {
00081     cGate* hostGate = host->gate(gateName);
00082     if(hostGate->isConnectedOutside()) {
00083       opp_error("Gate %s is still connected but not registered with this "
00084             "NicEntry. Either the last NicEntry for this NIC did not "
00085             "clean up correctly or another gate creation module is "
00086             "interfering with this one!", gateName);
00087     }
00088     assert(hostGate->isConnectedInside());
00089     gates.push_back(hostGate);
00090 
00091     ++i;
00092     sprintf(gateName, pattern, nicId, i);
00093   }
00094 
00095   return i - 1;
00096 }
00097 
00098 void NicEntryDebug::collectFreeGates()
00099 {
00100   if(!checkFreeGates)
00101     return;
00102 
00103   inCnt = collectGates("in%d-%d", freeInGates);
00104   nicEV << "found " << inCnt << " already existing usable in-gates." << endl;
00105 
00106 
00107   outCnt = collectGates("out%d-%d", freeOutGates);
00108   nicEV << "found " << inCnt << " already existing usable out-gates." << endl;
00109 
00110   checkFreeGates = false;
00111 }
00112 
00113 
00114 cGate* NicEntryDebug::requestInGate(void) {
00115   collectFreeGates();
00116 
00117   // gate of the host
00118   cGate *hostGate;
00119 
00120   if (!freeInGates.empty()) {
00121     hostGate = freeInGates.back();
00122     freeInGates.pop_back();
00123   } else {
00124     char gateName[20];
00125 
00126     // we will have one more in gate
00127     ++inCnt;
00128 
00129     //get a unique name for the gate (composed of the nic module id and a counter)
00130     sprintf(gateName, "in%d-%d", nicId, inCnt);
00131 
00132     // create a new gate for the host module
00133     cModule* const pHost = FindModule<>::findHost(nicPtr);
00134     pHost->addGate(gateName, cGate::INPUT);
00135     hostGate = pHost->gate(gateName);
00136 
00137     // gate of the nic
00138     cGate *nicGate;
00139 
00140     // create a new gate for the nic module
00141     nicPtr->addGate(gateName, cGate::INPUT);
00142     nicGate = nicPtr->gate(gateName);
00143 
00144     // connect the hist gate with the nic gate
00145     hostGate->connectTo(nicGate);
00146 
00147     // pointer to the phy module
00148     ChannelAccess* phyModule;
00149     // gate of the phy module
00150     cGate *phyGate;
00151 
00152     // to avoid unnecessary dynamic_casting we check for a "phy"-named submodule first
00153     if ((phyModule = dynamic_cast<ChannelAccess *> (nicPtr->getSubmodule("phy"))) == NULL)
00154       phyModule = FindModule<ChannelAccess*>::findSubModule(nicPtr);
00155     assert(phyModule != 0);
00156 
00157     // create a new gate for the phy module
00158     phyModule->addGate(gateName, cGate::INPUT);
00159     phyGate = phyModule->gate(gateName);
00160 
00161     // connect the nic gate (the gate of the compound module) to
00162     // a "real" gate -- the gate of the phy module
00163     nicGate->connectTo(phyGate);
00164   }
00165 
00166   return hostGate;
00167 }
00168 
00169 cGate* NicEntryDebug::requestOutGate(void) {
00170   collectFreeGates();
00171 
00172   // gate of the host
00173   cGate *hostGate;
00174 
00175   if (!freeOutGates.empty()) {
00176     hostGate = freeOutGates.back();
00177     freeOutGates.pop_back();
00178   } else {
00179     char gateName[20];
00180 
00181     // we will have one more out gate
00182     ++outCnt;
00183 
00184     //get a unique name for the gate (composed of the nic module id and a counter)
00185     sprintf(gateName, "out%d-%d", nicId, outCnt);
00186 
00187     // create a new gate for the host module
00188     cModule* const pHost = FindModule<>::findHost(nicPtr);
00189     pHost->addGate(gateName, cGate::OUTPUT);
00190     hostGate = pHost->gate(gateName);
00191 
00192     // gate of the nic
00193     cGate *nicGate;
00194     // create a new gate for the nic module
00195     nicPtr->addGate(gateName, cGate::OUTPUT);
00196     nicGate = nicPtr->gate(gateName);
00197 
00198     // connect the hist gate with the nic gate
00199     nicGate->connectTo(hostGate);
00200 
00201     // pointer to the phy module
00202     ChannelAccess* phyModule;
00203     // gate of the phy module
00204     cGate *phyGate;
00205 
00206     // to avoid unnecessary dynamic_casting we check for a "phy"-named submodule first
00207     if ((phyModule = dynamic_cast<ChannelAccess *> (nicPtr->getSubmodule("phy"))) == NULL)
00208       phyModule = FindModule<ChannelAccess*>::findSubModule(nicPtr);
00209     assert(phyModule != 0);
00210 
00211     // create a new gate for the phy module
00212     phyModule->addGate(gateName, cGate::OUTPUT);
00213     phyGate = phyModule->gate(gateName);
00214 
00215     // connect the nic gate (the gate of the compound module) to
00216     // a "real" gate -- the gate of the phy module
00217     phyGate->connectTo(nicGate);
00218   }
00219 
00220   return hostGate;
00221 }
